result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Hale Kodrich

defendant.name: Kodrich, Anthony Hale
defendant.address: 2111 South Livingston Terrace, West Allis, WI 53219

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court.  Defendant not present, out of custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  Court takes no action as to bail.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Defendant has until 7/19/2022 to comply with Justice Point.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Swanson br 11 room 316SB.  kmw

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Hale Kodrich not in court, in custody, CJF.  Patrick J Anderson for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense bail motion argued and denied.  This case will be global resolution with 21CM2188 and 21CF289  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Hale Kodrich in court, appear by video with attorney Angel L Johnson, appear by video.  Defendant Anthony Hale Kodrich in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Judge Franke. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CVS Pharmacy (76/Oklahoma)
No Contact Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Anthony Hale Kodrich in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Anthony Hale Kodrich in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Hale Kodrich appeared by video means with Attorney. Case retabbed due to lower number case(s) pending. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1 and 3. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
